citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A white female mini-poodle, ID 219, DOB 9-7-22, was observed to be non-weight bearing lame on the right front leg. The
wrist joint was moderately swollen. The licensee reported the dog jumped off the grooming table (approximately 4 feet
high) 2 days ago and has been limping since then. The licensee has not contacted the attending veterinarian and has not
administered any treatments.
Lameness is an important indicator of pain and/or musculoskeletal abnormality. A failure to properly identify lame dogs
delays proper identification of the underlying cause which delays treatment and can prolong suffering.
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate this animal and determine an appropriate plan
for diagnosis and treatment.
Correct by: March 9, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A white female mini-poodle, ID 219, DOB 9-7-22, was observed to be non-weight bearing lame on the right front leg. The

high) 2 days ago and has been limping since then. The licensee has not contacted the attending veterinarian and has not 
administered any treatments. 
Lameness is an important indicator of pain and/or musculoskeletal abnormality. A failure to properly identify lame dogs 
delays proper identification of the underlying cause which delays treatment and can prolong suffering. 
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate this animal and determine an appropriate plan 
for diagnosis and treatment. 
Correct by: March 9, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
